availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James O'Hara (Lyon County, Kentucky, merchant and dry goods maker)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, merchant and dry goods maker. Kentucky native. Son of Reuben R. O'Hara and Mary A. O'Hara. Married to Mary A. Lyon. Merchant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Merchant in Lyon County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 5, p. 125.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 1.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Lyon County, KY, June 1863, p. 324 / 636 on microfilm (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "James O'Hara (1835-1873)," Memorial #6656627, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/6656627 (accessed June X, 2020).
